str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Freedom, liberty, especially: a state of freedom from slavery. From eleutheros; freedom.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Freedom, liberty, especially: a state of freedom from slavery. From eleutheros; freedom.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From a compound of apo and hormao; a starting-point, i.e. an opportunity.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To be a slave, be subject to, obey, be devoted. From doulos; to be a slave to.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
